def convert_abb_word(word):
    return abbreviations[word.lower()] if word.lower() in abbreviations.keys() else word



def convert_abbrev_in_text(text):
    tokens = word_tokenize(text)
    tokens = [convert_abb_word(word) for word in tokens]
    text = ' '.join(tokens)
    return text

    tweet = re.sub(r"viaYouTube", "via YouTube", tweet)
           
    # Urls
    tweet = re.sub(r"https?:\/\/t.co\/[A-Za-z0-9]+", "", tweet)
    tweet = re.sub(r'https?://\S+|www\.\S+','', tweet)
        
    # Words with punctuations and special characters
    punctuations = '@#!?+&*[]-%.:/();$=><|{}^' + "'`"
    for p in punctuations:
        tweet = tweet.replace(p, f' {p} ')
        
    # ... and ..
    tweet = tweet.replace('...', ' ... ')
    if '...' not in tweet:
        tweet = tweet.replace('..', ' ... ')      
        
    # Acronyms
    tweet = re.sub(r"MH370", "Malaysia Airlines Flight 370", tweet)

    tweet = re.sub(r"Bestnaijamade", "bestnaijamade", tweet)

    # Abbreviation
    
    tweet = convert_abb_word(tweet)

    tweet = tweet.lower()
    
    
    
    
    
    return tweet

# Reference : https://gist.github.com/slowkow/7a7f61f495e3dbb7e3d767f97bd7304b
def remove_emoji(text):
    emoji_pattern = re.compile("["
                           u"\U0001F600-\U0001F64F"  # emoticons
                           u"\U0001F300-\U0001F5FF"  # symbols & pictographs
                           u"\U0001F680-\U0001F6FF"  # transport & map symbols
                           u"\U0001F1E0-\U0001F1FF"  # flags (iOS)
                           u"\U00002702-\U000027B0"
                           u"\U000024C2-\U0001F251"
                           "]+", flags=re.UNICODE)
    return emoji_pattern.sub(r'', text)

remove_emoji("I am tired 😔😔")

# Initialize and train the model (this will take some time)
from gensim.models import word2vec  # to create word vectors



# assign word vectors from word2vec model

EMBEDDING_SIZE  = 300  # each word in word2vec model is represented using a 300 dimensional vector
VOCABULARY_SIZE = len(word_tokenizer.word_index) + 1



word2vec= word2vec.Word2Vec(df['text'],workers=4,
                          size=EMBEDDING_SIZE, min_count = 2,window = 20,sg=1)


# create an empty embedding matix
embedding_weights = np.zeros((VOCABULARY_SIZE, EMBEDDING_SIZE))

# create a word to index dictionary mapping
word2id = word_tokenizer.word_index

# copy vectors from word2vec model to the words present in corpus
for word, index in word2id.items():
    try:
        embedding_weights[index, :] = word2vec[word]
    except KeyError:
        pass
